instructions: From any Home screen, tap Apps . Tap Mail . Select one of the following options: Gmail Yahoo! Mail Microsoft Hotmail Other (POP3/IMAP) Enter your email address. Tap the Password field and enter your password. Tap NEXT . Edit your account name and your display name as desired. Tap FINISH SETUP .

From any Home screen, tap Apps . Tap Mail . Tap the Menu icon. Tap Add account . Select one of the following options: Gmail Yahoo! Mail Microsoft Hotmail Other (POP3/IMAP) Enter your email address. Tap the Password field and enter your password. Tap NEXT . Edit your account name and your display name as desired. Tap FINISH SETUP .
From any Home screen, tap Apps . Tap Settings . Tap Accounts & sync . Navigate to and select the account you want to delete. Tap the Menu icon, then tap Remove . Tap REMOVE ACCOUNT .

From any Home screen, tap the App tray . Tap Settings . Under 'Connections', tap Mobile networks . Tap Access Point Names . If available, tap the T-Mobile US APN (the bullet point fills with green). If not available, tap MORE , and then tap New APN . Note : To reset your APN settings, tap MORE and then tap Reset to default . Verify and update the following settings for the Data APN: Name: T-Mobile US LTE APN: fast.t-mobile.com Proxy: <Not set> Port: <Not set> Username: <Not set> Password: <Not set> Server: <Not set> MMSC: http://mms.msg.eng.t-mobile.com/mms/wapenc MMS proxy: <Not set> MMS port: <Not set> MMS protocol: WAP 2.0 MCC: 310 MNC: 260 Authentication type: <Not set> APN type: <Not set> OR Internet+MMS APN protocol: IPv4/IPv6 APN roaming protocol: IPv4 Enable/disable APN: <greyed out unless there are multiple APN's> Bearer: Unspecified Tap MORE . Tap Save . Tap the desired APN profile you want to use. The bullet point fills with green next to the APN profile.
From the Home screen, tap the Apps icon. Tap Settings . Scroll to 'Connections,' then tap Mobile networks . Tap Network operators . Tap Search now .

From the Home screen, tap the Apps icon. Tap Settings . Scroll to 'Connections,' then tap Mobile networks . Tap Network mode . Tap one of the following desired band settings: LTE / WCDMA (auto connect) (LTE setting)WCDMA only
From the Home screen, tap the Apps icon. Tap Settings . Scroll to 'Connections,' then tap Airplane mode . Slide the Airplane mode Switch right to the ON or OFF position.
From the Home screen, tap the Apps icon. Tap Settings . Scroll to 'Connections,' then tap Mobile networks . Slide the Data roaming Switch to the ON or OFF position.
From the Home screen, tap the Apps icon. Tap Settings . Scroll to 'Connections,' then tap Data usage . Slide the Mobile data Switch to the ON or OFF position.
